title: Nice start but has bugs and misses essential features
comment: Turn Wi-Fi off when screen is off for x minutes does not work correctly if screen is off with the phone awake, e.g. when playing music with screen off during commute. Wi-Fi on while charging does not keep Wi-Fi on all the time (e.g. during the night to auto refresh google newsstand) but only switches on Wi-Fi periodically. In addition I want an option to keep Wi-Fi on while in certain locations, and be able to turn Wi-Fi off in certain locations (I have the same SSID in two locations and in one location connection is really bad so I want to use 3G network).

Well, the "turn WiFi off is screen is off for x min" option is not a "turn WiFi off if display is off for x minutes but not if app xyz is running, if it's a sunny day and if it's full moon tonight" option ;)

title: Perfect
comment: I use it to keep wifi on only. Works great. I have two old samsung galaxy prevail phones 2.23 android I use with ipwebcam ap n ispy for pc. At times in my area wifi signals get heavy n interupts the signals from my router to the phones. When this happens ispy makes several connections to the ipwebcam ap on the phone quickly in sequence. This results in the phones and/or ipwebcam app getting overloaded n the wifi on the phones just turns off completely. This app turns the wifi back on within the 5 min or less mark every time without a problem. Makes my old phone technology useful again. Thank u so much for a great product. One request is that if an option could be added for 3 mins and 1 min that would be excellent!

title: Use "Wi-Fi Automatic" instead of this one
comment: This probably has some great bells and whistles that I just didn't need, but it didn't do the basics, hence my low score.  I wanted to control my settings so that 1) the wifi comes on when a power source is introduced and 2) the wifi turns off once a power source is removed.  This app does #1 (and well), but does not do #2.  Wi-Fi Automatic does both.  ...and in response to the developer's response, which completely alleviated any regret I had about giving such a low score: You didn't address my issue, you just got upset.  Since you forgot to be constructive in your response, I'll help you.  Everyone downloads this app (and the many, many others like it) for one reason.  You had one job.  That job is to prevent wifi from draining the battery.  Your app does not do that.  If it does do #2 above, you should've put that in your response.  I would've then started using your app again, changed my rating, and felt pretty stupid frankly.  None of that happened.   My 1 star rating is to help guide other app users since there are many apps like this.  My constructive criticism was to explain my review and provide specific notes.  I'm sorry this made you upset.

Wow, giving a 1-star-rating because this free app does not 100% fulfill all your needs... If you wanted to have this feature implemented you could #1 post it on the suggestions website or #2 implement it on your own as the app is open source. The app does indeed save battery for example by turning WiFi off when your display is off

1 If you need support with the app, please post an issue to the bugtracker or contact me by mail. Make sure you don't use a task killer app. 2 I don't really understand what you mean there, I never said anything about increased data usage

Other than that a REALLY useful app I would recommend!

title: Mean and lean
comment: In quite a small package, this app does what it promises.  I really like that one can configure it to try to connect to a network, periodically or when recharging.  If anything, I wish that I could select which networks it should look for, because I'd rather not use the work network unless necessary.  Perhaps it could also use location services to turn WiFi on, like one's Google's Home and Work locations.  A note of caution: the advanced WiFi option "Keep WiFi on during sleep" should be set to "Always", or this app won't work properly.

title: Almost perfect
comment: It does Not turn off Wi-Fi on the moto x. Wi-Fi is still shown as checked

title: Argh >:(
comment: What the...! It keeps turning off my WiFi while I'm watching YouTube videos.
If you have issues with the app, please send me a mail so I can send you the debug version

title: Works if you have screen lock enabled
comment: Was apprehensive about installing this on my phone as it says its designed for use on WiFi-only tablets. But it seems to be working well on Xperia Ray. What I don't like is that it keeps running permanently in the background taking up precious RAM. Footprint is quite low, though. I don't know if it can be implemented without requiring it to run all the time, but guess there are similar apps that can do so. Another thing I didn't like is that if you don't use a screen lock, the WiFi does not turn on automatically. Because of this app, I now have to keep the screen lock enabled, which I find irritating. Please consider having the option to turn on with screen on instead of just phone unlock.  Though Android has a WiFi policy where you can set it to do the same thing without any 3rd paty app, I need this as it does not work properly in the custom ROM I'm using (WiFi keeps waking up, esp is Google apps are allowed location access).

title: Perfect. App...
comment: Working very excellent & settings is very pakka..(good) Jesus will bless this introducer....

title: LG G2
comment: Stamina from my XperiaZ comes to G2, thanks. Shame that not all vendors include same feature in theirs Rom.

title: Missing features
comment: This app seems to be working as advertised, but not as I had hoped. 1. WiFi is turned back on when the screen is unlocked, but not if the screen is merely turned on from a not-locked state. 2. WiFi timeout happens after screen is turned off even when the device (Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 8") is connected to power, which is not what I want.

title: Excellent lightweight app
comment: Perfictly does what i need and no useless extra features. And, unlike some other lightweight wifi togglers, works reliable! Please add the option turn off wifi if not connected to any network after x minutes. If using wifi scanning app wifi should be left on for more than 1 minute.

title: Best app ever
comment: Exactly what I was looking for . Bit however I wished it had more configurable options and also have ability to control data and n the same way .

title: Simply works
comment: No extra worthless bells and whistle. Just simply works as designed. Thanks!

title: Može još bolje
comment: Nervira me sto neki put u notifikaciji status jacine signala zamrzne. Ne poklapa se sa istim u podesavanju za WIFI. Jedino to resite. Ostalo OK.

title: Fine
comment: Works good, but there's few bugs: * No ongoing notification, can't know if it's running or not * Can't set after how many minutes without connection to disable Wi-Fi  BUG: After having this run in background for some hours, Wi-Fi setting gets stuck in off state and only reboot fixes it. For this reason, uninstalling.

title: Simple
comment: Very simple app.  Incredibly effective

title: Nice
comment: saves battery power

title: Please...
comment: ...add an option to turn on WiFi every x minutes. Thanks!
Fantastic

title: Bad
comment: Not working
Could you describe WHAT exactly doesn't work?

title: Nice little app
comment: Turnoff works perfectly for me. Turn on doesn't, but turnoff is what I really need anyway. Can turn on manually if desired. Also had the benefit of being very lightweight. Juice Defender obviously had more control over radios and is a great app, but resource heavy...i.e. dropped my 3D Mark fps by 7.

title: Works fine
comment: Works fine on my Nexus 7. Will edit post after a full recharge to fully test this apps. Good job dev
